p: Solid lipid microparticles (MPs) loaded with 0.1% of vitamin D 3 by spray chilling with mean diameter 83.0–98.6 μm that were fabricated using vegetable fat as a carrier and beeswax (1% of the formulation) showed increased vitamin stability at 25 °C, and 86.3% of vitamin were detected after 65 days of storage compared to 60.8% estimated with non-immobilized vitamin at same conditions, suggesting the potential of using such formulation in foods [ 86].
